title: Assistant Registrar Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at SF State University
Interview Descriptions: It's a three tier interview process: 1) Application submission which is pretty straight forward. 2) Followed by manager interview--about an hour long 3) Then panel interview with the team. After that a decision is sent out pretty quickly.
Interview Questions: They asked on my experience

title: Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at SF State University (San Francisco, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed directly by supervisor. Asked about previous customer service experience and situational responses (i.e. what to do if patron asks something, how to deal with patron in bad mood, etc.)
Interview Questions: How do you deal with agitated patrons?

title: Associate Director of Admissions Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at SF State University
Interview Descriptions: First round was great. Easy and mellow 30 minute phone call. Second round was also great. Hour long zoom with a committee. Then never ever heard back from the Director. Has never returned a phone call or multiple emails. Incredible unprofessional.
Interview Questions: How do you run events.

title: Information Technology Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at SF State University (San Francisco, CA) in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: No contact between the app submission and the interview, the interview was scheduled via email and Interview over Zoom, most technical questions were average to easy difficulty. Offers were not given on the spot.
Interview Questions: How to fix specific computer issues and web issue

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at SF State University
Interview Descriptions: After the application submission, there was a group interview with teamwork and prioritization activities. There was also an individual interview with a professional staff member and a current student leader
Interview Questions: why do you want to be an RA? What's a time you had a conflict with someone and how was it resolved? How do you time manage?

title: Cashier Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at SF State University
Interview Descriptions: scheduled interview, it was on teams chat. 12 pre picked questions with 2-4 people who took turns. HR emails/call with offer. It did take a long time to hear back.
Interview Questions: what I know of what the positions entails.

title: Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at SF State University
Interview Descriptions: A simple phone call interview to see if the position would be a fit. Easy follow-up and very natural conversation. I had an easy feeling from the get-go and felt that all along the process.
Interview Questions: It depends as I imagine the positions would require different quesions.

title: Gardener Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at SF State University
Interview Descriptions: Efficient. I only had to answer 3 questions and pass a check. It was an ok process. I think it went ok for the most part. The head of landscaping interviewed me.
Interview Questions: Why I want to work there

title: Digital Marketing Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at SF State University (San Francisco, CA) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview process started with a thirty minute phone call and a get to know you type of feeling. Afterwards they send an email letting you if you have moved forward and if yes ask what time would be good for the next interview. Beware they may cancel an already scheduled interview with no reason given.
Interview Questions: Tell me a little bit about yourself.

title: Computer Science Summer Institute Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at SF State University
Interview Descriptions: I had an interview with one of the leads of the Summer Institute program and shared my previous experiences that qualified me for the job.  After that, I waited for a day and got the offer with a notice to add my work forms.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Student Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at SF State University
Interview Descriptions: The interview was almost like a panel with 2 people interviewing me. One was my potential manager and the other had a manager position but wouldn't be who I report to.  I was asked various types of questions such as background, experience and scenarios.
Interview Questions: What are your top 3 strengths?

title: Graduate SLP Program Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at SF State University
Interview Descriptions: This was a structured group interview. We all sat in a semi circle without the interviewers and were given a team-building prompt: discuss and come up with your next steps. It was clear and comfortable overall.
Interview Questions: You have a conflict with a coworker, how do you handle the situation?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at SF State University (San Francisco, CA)
Interview Descriptions: It was quite straight forward. We were asked to demo in front of the entire department and then brought into classes and told to start teaching the class. I had to teach for about 25 minutes, Overall, it was exactly what you expect.
Interview Questions: All of the questions I was asked are confidential.

title: Event Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at SF State University
Interview Descriptions: Basic questions about who I am and what my ideal work environment is. They also gave scenarios of what could happen during an event.  They asked fairly basic HR questions like how you are and work experience. Another question they asked was "Tell me a time you were under a lot of pressure and how did you adjust?"
Interview Questions: Tell me a time you were under a lot of pressure and how did you adjust?

title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at SF State University
Interview Descriptions: Pretty great interview, everyone was incredibly nice but it took months to hear the result. It was a little frustrating to have to wait so long to eventually not be offered the job.
Interview Questions: How do you handle speaking to parents?

title: Work Study Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at SF State University (San Francisco, CA) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed via Zoom but never heard back. I reached back out but still never heard anything back. Today I am still unsure if the position was ever filled.
Interview Questions: What do you bring to this position?

title: Senior Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at SF State University (San Francisco, CA) in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was neutral. A common question being asked. However, the process after the interview take a while to be hire. The manager and HR were not on the same page.
Interview Questions: Please tell us what do you know about our department

title: Research Assistant From Nursing Department Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at SF State University
Interview Descriptions: Smooth and easy interview. Professor asked a few questions about why you want to work in research projects, previous experiences working in a team, and weaknesses and strengths and language skills. Took 15 mins in total.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to participate in the research project?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at SF State University
Interview Descriptions: Oversee program and encourage professional development. Ensure students are motivated to keep wanting to flourish and be proud to graduate from sf state   This was a very unique interview because I knew right away it was a good community
Interview Questions: Give as an example Professional Challenge?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at SF State University
Interview Descriptions: Graduate Teaching Assistant interviews have always been very informal for me (I've done maybe half a dozen over the past two years) and just involve a chat with the professor who is teaching the class.
Interview Questions: What other classes have you TA'd for in the past?

title: Associated Students, Incorporated Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at SF State University (San Francisco, CA) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview was an in person, relaxed conversation. It was the supervisor and Director of the program present. They asked pretty basic interview questions that you would expect, such as strengths, weaknesses, a challenge you overcame etc.
Interview Questions: What was a challenge you overcome in the workplace, and how did you handle it?

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at SF State University (San Francisco, CA) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview I had was a quick 10 minute zoom interview on lab experience, social skills, and ability to work certain shifts. I was offered the job 2 days later and began working there after basic employee packet was filled. Lots of training in the beginning.
Interview Questions:
What is your overall comfort level in the laboratory

Tell me about a time you had to multitask

title: Health Coach Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at SF State University in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: The staff is passionate however the interviewing process is very intense. You'll need to prepare for an array of different questions. The waiting period is weeks long and multiple part  interviews.
Interview Questions: What policy changes would you create on campus?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at SF State University (San Francisco, CA) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: Applied for the position posted. I got contacted after a month through email, scheduled an interview. Did a video conference call with 3 people. Two were from the department of the job posted and the other person from the HR department. Unfortunately, I could not get the job offer.
Interview Questions:
What is your biggest accomplishment?
What are your weaknesses?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at SF State University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was easy. They ask you 10 questions then rate your answers. The people seem to have the interview very organized. They let you ask questions at the end.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Summer Student Research Assistant for CARE Lab Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at SF State University (San Francisco, CA) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions:
Need to get recommended by someone who is doing work in the lab and/or have to have a class with the professor (Dr. David Quintero) and show great promise. Also, it depends on what projects are available to be worked on and what available funding there is for those projects. Also, you will probably have to volunteer first before you'll be offered employment.

He also asked me about some of the stuff on my resume like the prior research experience I had.
Interview Questions: What projects would you be interested in working on?

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at SF State University
Interview Descriptions: Application submission, in-person interview, team interview, team discussion, team meetings, campus tour, meet and greet
Interview Questions: General scenario

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at SF State University (San Francisco, CA) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions:
The first step is for the applicant to fill out an application and to submit  the curriculum.
Applicant must complete a questionnaire with approximately ten questions. 
First interview: Phone/ZOOM interview
Second interview: Panel interview with stakeholders
Third interview: Interview with CIO
Interview Questions: How do you identify the project stakeholder?

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at SF State University in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online and received an interview request about a week later.  I live out of town so we scheduled a Zoom interview. The interview was with the hiring manager and another staff member and it went about 30 minutes. They asked about 5-6 questions and then shared more information with me about the position. 

I didn't hear anything a week after the interview, so I followed up and found out that another candidate had been selected.
Interview Questions: What role do you take on when working  in a group?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at SF State University (San Francisco, CA) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: After a questionnaire on Handshake, was asked to come in for a panel interview and asked a few questions about what I answered on Handshake.  The next day, I was asked to come in and fill out paper work regarding my financial aid status and right to work at the university.
Interview Questions: How would you remove viruses from a computer?

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at SF State University (San Francisco, CA) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: Received a phone call for a video interview right away, which was scheduled for the following week. After the video interview, I didn't hear anything for 4 weeks. I figured I hadn't qualified for the next round, so I was very surprised a month later to get a call about scheduling a campus interview. After that call, didn't hear anything for two weeks. Then got a call offering me a time for the interview. I was from out of state and would be flying there, so it was lucky that this one time slot offered worked for me. Went to the on campus interview, never heard back. I honestly was already really turned off by their lack of communication that I was not disappointed to not get the job, but found it pretty rude and unprofessional to not even send a rejection email after an in person interview. Overall found those I was interviewing with to be unfriendly in general, and it was not a positive experience.
Interview Questions: Had to give a presentation with little guidelines.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at SF State University (San Francisco, CA) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: They asked basic questions and some questions regarding my interests. They had me put cards in order to see if I knew what steps were involved in the Purchasing Department
Interview Questions: What are your strengths?

title: Associate Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at SF State University (San Francisco, CA) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: I was asked to participate in a Zoom interview, which lasted about a half hour. I spoke with three professors in the department on that call, in which two answered questions and one took notes. I never received a notification about interview status. Months later I followed up via email and did not receive a response.
Interview Questions: Q: Why do you want to teach?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at SF State University (San Francisco, CA) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions:
I currently possess a full-time faculty position at another school. I applied for a full-time faculty position within a particular college at SFSU. Three references were requested and included with the application. Two weeks after a Skype interview with the search committee, I was invited for an on-campus interview and to teach a sample lesson. The interview seemed to go well (indeed, several students stood and applauded at the end of my sample lecture) and I was told that I would likely be informed of the committee's decision in a couple of weeks, right by the end of the month. 

The end of the month came and went with no word. Then at the beginning of the following month, I received a surprise email from a member of the search committee. Apparently, the college's dean requested a reference from my current department chair, who I had not yet informed (as can be common practice in higher education) regarding my search for other employment opportunities. I was surprised at this request, as I had already furnished the committee with the requested three references in my original application (and the original application requirements did not specify that one of the three references had to be from a current supervisor). Further, when I reached out to my academic references for advice, they both concurred that this was a very strange, borderline disrespectful request. 

To the SFSU search committee's credit, they did acknowledge the sensitivity of the matter yet insisted that the reference from my current chair was necessary. I was confused, as I had imagined that my application materials and on-campus interview had been sufficient. Indeed, over the years I have been invited to on-campus interviews for close to a dozen other academic positions (when I was making the transition from adjunct to full-time) and had never once been asked for such a thing. I hoped that this meant that I was a finalist for the position, and despite the sensitivity of the situation, I contacted my current department chair who was gracious and understanding enough to write the reference and send it to SFSU.

At the end of that month and into the beginning of the following month (so now we're going on two months since the on-campus interview), I had received no word of any further progress or decisions from the SFSU search committee. I wrote them to inquire and to let them know that in the middle of the month, I had a deadline to sign a contract for another year at my current institution. I was then told that the decision was up to the dean.

The week of my contract deadline at my current institution arrived (this was now over two months since the on-campus interview) and still no word. I sent a polite email to the search committee mere days before my contract deadline requesting advice or information on how to move forward given the tricky timing.

I subsequently received an email from the search committee to inform me that the position had been filled - all I had to show from the entire opaque, mismanaged, disrespectful process. In the years that I sought full-time faculty employment, each search committee behind every interview I had was communicative, respectful, and apparently well-run. SFSU's hiring process was frustratingly cryptic, unforthcoming, and disorganized. I recommend against applying for a faculty position at this institution.
Interview Questions: Would you furnish the search committee with an additional reference, one from your current department chair?

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at SF State University (San Francisco, CA) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Panel interview with the department leader and staff member.
Asked questions regarding experience and work ethic. The interview went well because the staff were friendly and I got an offer at the spot. It was really great working with them.
Interview Questions: What kind of role do you play in a team?

title: IT ASSISTANT Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at SF State University (San Francisco, CA) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: Brief interview about proficiency with MAC and PC formats, along with basic networking and troubleshooting questions. They also asked about familiarity with video editing and production on the side. Only one interview with the supervisor was necessary prior to the job offer.
Interview Questions: Proficiency with iOS and Mac desktop format

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at SF State University (San Francisco, CA)
Interview Descriptions:
1st Email scheduling an Interview, followed by several reference checks with very thorough questions, followed by large panel interview, followed by one on one interview.
It was a very welcoming process, the questions were all very thorough.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Adjunct Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at SF State University (San Francisco, CA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied with CV and cover letter online.  I heard back from the faculty within a few days and was invited to meet with them in person.  I had a meeting with two faculty from the college where we discussed my experience and teaching philosophy.  They told me when they would get back to me - within a few days - and requested that I provide more information for their records in the meantime.  They contacted me by email with an offer a few days later and I accepted.
Interview Questions: Specific questions wouldn't be helpful for this job interview.   I described my experience - lecturing, mentoring and research - my teaching philosophy and where my strengths lay, and they then described how they designed their course and department norms.  It was a very comfortable discussion and they gave me a clear picture of the priorities of the school.

title: House Keeping Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at SF State University (San Francisco, CA) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: Group of 6 sat on the panel to interview me. Was an online printed interview, questions were fairly easy except some just confused you. Everyone on the panel was very nice, and easy going which allowed me to not get nervous. Heard back from the department in about 2 weeks, but the offered amount was not what i expected.
Interview Questions: What is something you do differently now.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at SF State University (San Francisco, CA) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was pretty simple and starightforward. I sent in my resume and got an email asking me to fill out a form. Then comes the interview round wherein they ask you questions based on your resume. Prepare for it such that it shows off some skill that you can use at the job as the student assistant. It is  a plus if you are referred by someone working there as a student assistant too.
Interview Questions: Standard tell me a little bit about yourself.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at SF State University (San Francisco, CA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview was fairly short as I got referred by a previous employee. I met with my supervisor and discussed my skills and experience. He asked me my availability times. It took 30 minutes to discuss my expectations and job duties.
Interview Questions: What are my learning expectations?

title: Sales Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at SF State University
Interview Descriptions: It was an open interview. Basically you have a group of people who are interviewed in a room by two interviewers. In the end, everyone was hireed. I guess they needed people badly. Interview questions are fairly easy, so everyone can be hired.
Interview Questions: What was your previous sales experience?

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at SF State University (San Francisco, CA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: it was easy and friendly . explain the job and duties briefly, what to expect, met the peers that work together on the first day. everything seems easy and relax. not really obnoxious.
Interview Questions: tell me about yourself please

title: International Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at SF State University (San Francisco, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Went in for a first interview with a panel of five different employees. Interview itself was good, though they did it in a large room which was rather disconcerting. Biggest complaint is that I never heard from them or the HR department after the interview. While I was perfectly ok with not getting the job, to never hear about their decision is extremely inconsiderate in my book. If you interview someone in-person, it is a requirement that you at least send an email. I would not want to work with people who don't view this as a basic courtesy.
Interview Questions: Experience with student records

title: Office & Events Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at SF State University (San Francisco, CA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very simple. Submit a resume and cover letter. If they like you, you will get a phone screen and then the offer if they select you. Not much else was needed.
Interview Questions: How much customer service experience do you have?

title: Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at SF State University
Interview Descriptions: It was easy. You still need to be prepared for the interview and know the job description beforehand. It is better to do some research on general interview questions. They will ask couple of technical questions related to the position you are applying for .
Interview Questions: Past experiences

title: Network Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at SF State University (San Francisco, CA) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: personal and technical, first phone  screening and thereafter personal group panel interview with three people. i was told at the end of the week whether I am selected or not. It was a really good experience and fun answering the interview . Very less stress level
Interview Questions: what you know  about network? how to patch a cable?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at SF State University
Interview Descriptions: Easy process, direct interview with your prospect managers. First by phone, then only one round of interview in person. As long as, you get to know the office and job description. If you like the work and who the passion to work there, then you should be fine
Interview Questions: Wat is your goal after SF State?

title: Help Desk Student IT Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at SF State University (San Francisco, CA) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: They had me submit an application and a week later they asked me to come for an interview. There were 6-7 people interviewing me. I had to answer questions from a piece of paper they had. There were about 10 questions and the whole process took less than one hour
Interview Questions: How many ping pong balls can fit in a bus?

title: Campus Shuttle Driver Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at SF State University
Interview Descriptions: I was called for an on-site interview. When I arrived, I was taken into the conference room. I was asked to introduce my self. Most of the questions were based on my resume and the previous experience I had as an office assistant and a driver. I had driving experience of more than 6 years so that was a plus point.
Interview Questions: How do you handle stressful situation?

title: Administrative Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at SF State University
Interview Descriptions: I applied online through the school's website. I received an interview offer about a month later. The interview was conducted by a 3-person panel and took appoximately 30 minutes. There was a set of questions that the panel asked, and they wrote down my response as I spoke. There was time at the end of the interview for me to ask the panel questions.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at SF State University (San Francisco, CA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was asked about my labwork related to Digital Design. I was asked about various combinational and sequential circuits. I was asked to design the same on Xilinx and test in by writing a code in VHDL.
Interview Questions: What are Combinational and Sequential Circuits?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at SF State University (San Francisco, CA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied to the position when a friend referred me to the position. I had a phone screening lasting around 30 minutes and an in-person interview lasting around an hour.
Interview Questions:
They asked basic interview questions such as: 
"Tell me about your self", "How do you manage your time?", etc. as well as situational questions regarding communication with customers: "How well do you communicate with others?", "How do you deal with a disgruntled customer?", etc.

title: Math and Science Tutor, Data Entry and Web-Site Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at SF State University (San Francisco, CA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: More of behavioral questions. No math related questions. The senior staff is really good and asked me to describe my past experience of tutoring. It was a easy but I suggest they should have asked me some math questions. Apart from that, we had multiple rounds of answering on situation based questions. It tests you on every aspect of situation based scenario but no mathematical skills were into picture as said earlier.
Interview Questions: How would you initiate the tutoring session once you meet the student?

title: Network Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at SF State University (San Francisco, CA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: it was easy and depend on the type of experience one has. check the requirements before applying.  They basically check the requirements and call for the interview after screening.
Interview Questions: what all these network device do/

title: Outreach Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at SF State University (San Francisco, CA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions:
The process included an email to set up a phone conversation a few weeks after application. 
It was a 45 minute call with at least 3 people asking very typical questions about how to handle different situations. An invitation for an on campus interview came a while after through an email. I was asked to prepare a 5 page plan for outreach and a short (2 page) plan for another initiative. Parking was not hosted and it started a few minutes late. The conference room in which the interview was held was very messy and doubled as a storage room. The interview lasted about 2 hours. An offer was made a month after.
Interview Questions: How do you handle a busy schedule?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at SF State University
Interview Descriptions:
It was pretty basic - reviewing resume, expected salary, schedule, etc... 
I applied through the department's job website. They asked me the standard questions and hired me. I worked during the summer and I was able to make contacts in other classes through the winter and spring and through the years.
Interview Questions: There was no difficult or unexpected questions.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at SF State University (San Francisco, CA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was asked about my previous job and was explained the full responsibilities of the job. I was told that i would be provided training for the job. I had to contact the potential alumni, employers etc for the interviews.
Interview Questions: Where have you worked before?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at SF State University (San Francisco, CA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Was just a simple process about the courses I wanted to teach. They talked about the whole process  and class regulations. The interviewer was so nice and did not ask so many questions.
Interview Questions: Specific questions about the material of the course

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at SF State University
Interview Descriptions: There was no interview. I was recommended by a professor and was then hired for the internship. I believe most internships in which you are recommended by a professor there will be no interview. It was a very easy process to be hired.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at SF State University (San Francisco, CA) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: This was with CARP.  Kind of silly how extensive the interview was considering this is a part-time job, no benefits, and not exactly a resume booster.  You will meet with two coordinators who will interview you for about an hour, and do a mock tutorial session.  Then, they will leave you in the room, confer with each other, and take you to meet the Big Boss if you succeed.  He will cut through your bullsh*t so make sure you come prepared beyond the generic "I'm a hard worker/good people person/self-starter" line.
Interview Questions: What do you know about our program?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at SF State University (San Francisco, CA) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: Interview was technical, required me to write code on the black board. not too formal, there was a panel involved. Its one of the good State institutions to apply to.
Interview Questions: do you know git, svn?

title: Composition for Multilingual Students Interview Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at SF State University
Interview Descriptions:
The first part of the interview is a two hour long process where you mark up a sample student's paper as if you were the teacher. They want to see  a) your approach and rationale to assessing and commenting on student writing and b) your familiarity with common ESL grammatical issues, as well as your pedagogical approach to grammar teaching. 

The second part of the interview will be a f2f interview with a 6 member CMS committee.
Interview Questions: Most difficult aspect turned out to be not knowing the department's philosophy, which was quite opposite of how the teachers I TAed with actually work.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at SF State University (San Francisco, CA) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Went to Circulation desk and met hiring supervisor. We went to her office and she asked some questions and went over a little bit o scheduling that I had submitted.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you would be a good fit in the library

title: Prospect Research and Management Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at SF State University (San Francisco, CA) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Straightforward process and interviewed with your future boss. People at the interview are very nice and try to get to know you as a person and whether you are a good fit for the company. Questions are also very straightforward.
Interview Questions: What is your best achievements at previous jobs? How comfortable are you working confidential information?

title: Audiovisual Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at SF State University (San Francisco, CA) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: They had a panel of student managers who interviewed me around a table. They asked me about how I would approach different situations, both professional and personal (like having a problem with a fellow employee).
Interview Questions: How would you handle a situation if you felt as though an employee were acting in a way that made you uncomfortable?

title: Book Store Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at SF State University (San Francisco, CA) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied and invited to a group interview in downtown sf. After that interview process I was called in to do a training on campus and then we where schedule to work the week before school semester at any folliet stores.
Interview Questions: Describe a time where you gave good customer service?

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at SF State University (San Francisco, CA) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Placed in a room with the tutorial coordinator and a staff. The tutorial coordinator was friendly and asked questions accordingly. She briefed me about what is it like to be a part of the tutoring team.
Interview Questions: What experience did you have relating to the job?

title: Accessible Media Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at SF State University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process of getting a part time position at San Francisco State is not  tedious. Eligible students can apply through Gator jobs and then interviews are not so hard. Reference always helps so make sure you are in good terms with your seniors.
Interview Questions: There were no unexpected questions.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at SF State University
Interview Descriptions: I applied through the school's job website. They emailed me after I sent in my application and when the interview time came, they asked me the standard questions and hired me. This was during the summer, and I was able to make contacts in another department to get a job through the winter and spring and through the years.
Interview Questions: No difficult questions, just standard ones.

title: Development Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at SF State University (San Francisco, CA) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: I submitted a resume online and was called to be interviewed by a group of administrators on campus.  I understood that this was the first round and that they would call back candidates they were interested in.  It wasn't a very friendly environment and I sensed that some of them weren't on the same page.  It was a very corporate feeling experience, more than I expected at a university.
Interview Questions: What is your experience with major gifts?

title: Text Editor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at SF State University (San Francisco, CA) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: The atmosphere was laid back.  They asked a lot of easy questions.  It was mostly a test of how well I would fit in socially with my supervisors and whether I would be happy sitting at a computer editing pdf files for the majority of the work day.  They were very nurturing.
Interview Questions: How are your computer skills?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at SF State University (San Francisco, CA) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: Chill and laid back. Very straight forward. Definitely need to be enthusiastic and open minded. You will need to answer scenario questions. Better chance if you were affiliated with at least the director of the program you're applying for. 15mins-30mins tops since all interviewees are after another doing their interview.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for us?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at SF State University (San Francisco, CA) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: Apply through Gator Jobs and interview with a department lead. If they like you, you will be contacted in about a week or so for an interview. Once you are hired (must be eligible for work study) you will go through some paper work for HR. If you get a job as a student assistant, you will only be paid once a month.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Writing Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at SF State University (San Francisco, CA) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: Pretty standard interview. I was called in, had to talk through some hypothetical situations and how I would deal with them. Then there was a short role play section where I had to advise a 'student' on their writing.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with a student asking you to edit a paper for them?

title: Administrative Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at SF State University (San Francisco, CA) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: why you want this job, what policies you know about the job. you apply online, the department sets up an interview. it takes 3-4 weeks for the whole process before you are offered the awful salary.
Interview Questions: why you want the job

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at SF State University (San Francisco, CA) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: Easy & straightforward. Just met with the manager 1:1. Asked me a couple of regular questions about my background, skills, etc. Then met with the Chair of the department - same idea. Nothing crazy. Doesn't need any special prep or guidance.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at SF State University (San Francisco, CA) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: Interview with the person in the department wants to hire you. Contact the department or website to see if there are any availability, if yes contact the hiring person. If they think you a good fit, they will schedule to have an interview with you.
Interview Questions: They will ask why would you want to take this position, what is your goal to work as this position?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at SF State University (San Francisco, CA) in Dec 2010
Interview Descriptions: Simple.
Interview Questions: Describe yourself.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at SF State University (San Francisco, CA) in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions: I was only interviewed by the PI of the lab. Very casual. I had coffee with the PI and discussed the research I'd be doing as well as the research the other lab members were working on. I then met with the other lab members and gave a power point seminar during their lab meeting. A slightly awkward lunch with the lab followed.
Interview Questions: There were no difficult or unexpected questions.

title: Administrative Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at SF State University (San Francisco, CA) in Aug 2008
Interview Descriptions: The process takes months.  There is to much paperwork to get done in order to get hired.  You also have to submit an application in person with HR.  At least this was the process in 2008.  It seems that between HR, the hiring manager, your manager, and the unit supervisor there is no communication.  The wait for an entry level job should not take more than a few weeks to have someone in place.  This took months.
Interview Questions: The questions are very simple.  What is your strength/weakness?  Where do you see yourself in 5 years?  How do you handle stress?

title: IT Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at SF State University (San Francisco, CA) in Mar 2008
Interview Descriptions: You might be interviewing with a lot of people, depending on the job you apply. If you can get to know those people in advance that would help a lot.
Interview Questions: What project have you worked on (or lead) in the past 3-5 years. How do you deal with a difficult co-worker? Analyze your own strengths and weaknesses.
